text.p: PolyGram NV, announcing that full-year 1996 operating profit would be flat or slightly lower than in 1995 and that it would additionally take a $90 million restructuring charge in 1996, said it had been affected by sluggish music markets but also by issues specific to PolyGram.
It said its plans to address these problems would include the following steps:

* Restructuring Motown's operations including management changes, the high cost of the A&R overhaul to revitalise the artist roster and expenses associated with moving Motown's headquarters to New York from Los Angeles;
* Reorganising Europe's music distribution and marketing operations in response to a flat market;
PolyGram said that at present its film business was expected to proceed according to plan.
The company, majority owned by Philips Electronics NV , is due to announce its 1996 results on February 12, 1997.
